title: Wonderful organisation
body: An excellent service, Very friendly Staff at St Catherine’s facility.They have restored My sight and I can’t thank Them enough Philip Price

title: Amazing GP and helpful staff
body: I went their for sinus issue. The doctors are amazing there, very kind and helpful. The nursing staff is also amazing.

title: Great Service by Doctor
body: I would like to praise the doctor at this practice he is outstanding and helped me to get seen at the hospital after assessing my health I was diagnosed with a tumour and treatment was started immediately whilst i was an inpatient. Thank you so much Botwell Medical Centre amazing team.

title: Helpful and efficient interaction
body: Due to Covid, I avoid going to the practice but need a flu jab.  The appointment was made and I have been sent reminders by phone and email to ensure that I will use my booked time OR contact them if this becomes impossible.  Interaction has been informative and pleasant.  My medication has been collected by others and I have not had to visit the surgery to collect since March.  Phone consultations have been available for a non-Covid condition and I was able to deal with that myself after getting medical advice.  It has enabled me to handle something quite minor at home and for the future since it is a chronic situation.

title: Very efficient and kind
body: From the summer when I first had stomach pain through to November when I had my ovaries removed, the service has been excellent.  All blood tests and referrals were completed quickly and in a reassuring way.  These are the best doctors I have come across after being at two other surgeries in my lifetime.  Reception staff are clearly busy but do their best to help.

title: Easily the worst Gp practice
body:
This is easily the worst Gp practice. Either you are unable to get through at all, or if the phone is not engaged and reception do answer, you are obliged to discuss your medical complaint with the RECEPTIONIST. Yes you read that correctly. With an entirely untrained medical person...... who will then fob you off and not “allow” you to speak to a doctor. Total negligence. Oh and the practice manager is easily the rudest person I have ever had to interact with. I think I have an infection which I have had for almost 6 months. Yet blocked from discussing with a gp everytime by unqualified receptionists. Speak to nhs 111 and they advise speaking to my gp. Go figure?

This surgery is an absolute shambles. Do NOT register here.

title: Great Pharmacist
body: I am a retied professional person. I have been very impressed and grateful with the care an the detailed explanations provided to me by the pharmacist at the practice who has given me a series of blood test and reviews regarding my general health to a degree and a manner that I have never previously received of this nature.

author: blueep83
title: A daunting day made more bearable.
body:
My almost 2 year old daughter attended at ward 1A/B recently in order to under go a rheumatology procedure under general anaesthetic.  
First impressions of the ward was fantastic, clean and tidy with a festive atmosphere.  
All of the doctors, nurses and health care staff were fantastic throughout our stay. My daughter was provided with various items to entertain her, books, colouring pens etc.  
Everything was explained to us thoroughly and staff were happy to answer any questions we had.  
Upon completion of the procedure, as expected my daughter was quite upset whilst within the recovery ward, once again the staff were brilliant, offering plenty of things to distract her and plenty of treats such as ice cream and ice lollies.  
We would like to offer our thanks to all of the staff at RHC for making a daunting day, much more bearable, and at times we even forgot we were within a hospital environment.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: A&E Waiting Times (TV says 2-3hrs) Actual…
body:
A&E Waiting Times (TV says 2-3hrs) Actual 4-6hrs

- No communication about how or when you will be treated.
-No details of when you are going to be seen or how you are prioritised.

- Advertising 2-3 hr waiting times; when actual waiting times are 4-6hrs !!!!! 

-Sadly it feels like we were exposed to more illnesses waiting with 3 vomits while waiting on the floor and around our vicinity.

- Toilets not very well maintained, no toilet role in one, no soap to wash your hands in another !!!

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Amazing care from magnolia team
body: The care I have received from the Magnolia Maternity team has been absolutely incredible. Such personalised care - I've been so well looked after. The team have been great at listening to me and meeting my needs. They have acted quickly with any request I've had. I feel so incredibly reassured to be in their care. I cannot express enough how truly wonderful they've been. A fantastic service that I wish more women could have access to.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

author: Alison Penny
title: Experience at the Flu Clinic
body:
I attended Carrickfergus health centre for a flu vaccination I appreciate that they are organising a large number of appointments for vaccinations at this time and that the current regulations increase work load and stress on staff. However, having only left the house a number of times since March, I was quite taken aback.  
Patients were required to wait outside (no marking for social distancing) for admittance by one of the admin staff. It was a particularly cold November morning and this is not appropriate for some elderly and vulnerable people. A one way system had been put in place for the clinic - no chairs had been provided for those who were unable to stand for long periods and as a result the corridors was lined with people that were leaning against and touching windowsills and walls. Whilst there was sanitiser available at the entrance, I didn't see anyone being asked to use it. Masks were being worn and temperatures were being taken although how accurate these were after a lengthy period standing in the cold is debatable. Hand sanitiser was available again before patients were called into the clinical area and apart from myself, I did not see anyone use it. Whilst patients were waiting to be called in, numerous staff were arriving at work or returning from or leaving for visits, many with bags and trolleys and all using the same entrance, causing congestion at the doors - why was everyone using this entrance?  
Having been called into the clinical area, by one person, another two members of staff were giving out pieces of paper to indicate vaccinations to be given - I am not sure why it was necessary to do this particularly as these would be handled by people with unsanitised hands and passed to clinical staff. There were several cubicles in which vaccinations were being given and patients left the building via a side door although there was no signage to indicate how to return to the car park. Not one member of staff introduced themselves or spoke politely to me nor anyone around me, whilst appreciate that instructions need to be given - please and thank you can be useful additions to the imperative.  
Quite frankly, it felt like a cattle market - herd them in - herd them out.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: skibird45
title: More confusing than enlightening
body:
I was having ureteric stent fitted.  
Once admitted to hospital both the registrar and the anaesthetist were exceptionally good at explaining what was going to be happening. The anaesthetist also spoke to me about what he was doing until I fell asleep. For the first time since the hospital records were computerised EVERYONE managed to call me by the name I have always been known by, although it is my second name. I can’t overemphasise what a difference that makes, rather than being called by what feels like somebody else’s name. I felt increasing relaxed, following my less happy experience of the the pre-op assessment.There the staff were kind, but I felt quite overwhelmed by the amount of paperwork they gave me to read at home. I received:3 booklets: “Patient admission and information booklet”, “Department of Scheduled Admissions” and “”Fasting before your operation”. These were all clear, readable and laid out in a way that made it easy to find the information I wanted.A 24-page A4 booklet called “ Anaesthesia explained” covering everything from details of general anaesthetic to paracetamol, and all the grades of staff involved. This was far more than I needed to know, and in the absence of clarity as to which form of anaesthetic I was going to receive (see below) was more confusing than enlightening. A single sheet about the relevant form of anaesthesia would have been simpler to absorb. Information about whether and when to stop each of my medications before the operation. This was presumably important, and was clear. Two questionnaires to complete at home, and return. Both consisted of questions I had already been asked at the pre-op assessment. One for hospital records, which at least was simple. The other was described as a pre-operative anaesthetic questionnaire. This was more difficult as I was not clear which aspects of my medical history under the different items were really relevant, and I did not know how the nurse who had conducted the interview at the assessment had completed it in the interview. I was instructed to complete it and bring It with me when I came into hospital. When I saw the anaesthetist, I said: “I have a completed questionnaire to give you”, and he said: “I don’t think so”. So I needn’t have worried!A 5-page leaflet described as Patient Information for Consent, R14 Inserting an Anterograde Ureteric Stent. This I found both confusing and stressful as it contained information which not only differed from what the consultant had previously told me, but positively contradicted it at times, although I did know that I was having a ureteric stent fitted. I phoned the consultant’s secretary to arrange a telephone consultation. The consultant was unaware that information about procedures was being given out at the pre-op assessment, and said he would be quite interested to see it. After discussion about what it said he informed me that I had been given information about a different procedure from the one I would be getting. I was able to be reassured that the leaflet I had already been given by the consultant, produced by BAUS, was the relevant one rather than the NHS Grampian one. This did, however, leave me slightly nervous as to whether I would be receiving the correct procedure when I was admitted. (I was totally reassured by the registrar on admission.)A sheet giving me the telephone number of the consultant’s Secretary, with instructions to contact her about any changes to my health. This phone number would have been very useful ( see above) if I had not already been given it. I reached the letter starting “Please find enclosed admission documents.....” last, which probably didn’t help as my stress level was already raised. This wasn’t helped by the fact that about half of it was in bold. There was a statement “ “If you do not adhere to this advice, your procedure may have to be cancelled” (in bold) beside an item I could not comply with as I live alone. Thankfully I had said this to the nurse at the interview, and she had not been concerned (though she had noted it), but this still left me somewhat uneasy. There were other statements: “failure to do so may result in your appointment/admission being delayed” - twice, once in bold - and “FAILURE TO DO SO MAY RESULT IN A DELAY TO YOUR TREATMENT.” Clearly the instructions are important, but could there not be one warning to cover them all, rather than what comes across as repeated threats? The original part of this letter was clear, but the part added in relation to Coronavirus had very obviously not been vetted by someone with an interest in plain English, I had to read two of the paragraphs more than once to pick up the main point. For example: instead of saying : “ It is now policy that all patients attending for a procedure must adhere to strict and comprehensive social distancing measures for a period of 14 days prior to their admission date coupled with strict hand hygiene measures. The guidance around strict and comprehensive social distancing are ensuring that you remain a 2 metres physical distance from anyone outwith those within your own household”, why not just say: “For 14 days before your admission you must keep at least 2 metres away from anyone who is not a member of your own household. You must also wash your hands frequently.”NOTE: It is not the first time in the last 13 months that I have found that those at the coal face were not aware of the information being given to patients prior to attendance, or that that information was not correct. I also experienced both recently when attending the cataract clinic. It appears that there may be a pattern here in Grampian Healthcare.

author: kmitch
title: Excellent care at the max fax department at RCH
body:
I am a member of staff at the trust and am immensely proud to work here anyway, but I have to say that the care that my son received has been outstanding. He had an accident at school and damaged his teeth quite badly. My local dentist liaised with the max fax department and they were able to offer us an appointment 2 days later.  
The doctor we saw was amazing with my little boy, putting him completely at ease at what could have been a really worrying time. Everything was explained to me really clearly and I left knowing exactly what the plan was and what we had to look out for to know if things were getting worse. This was really reassuring as a panicking Mother! I found out today, after a phone call from my dentist, that the doctor has called them to arrange a follow up for us in the next couple of weeks. The communication between the max fax department and my dentist has been outstanding.  
As an aside the doctor apologised for us being late into our appointment- for a start there was no need to apologise as we had been fitted in to be seen within a couple of days which was great and we were so grateful for that. Also while we were waiting I had seen this doctor taking his patient over to the scanning department in the hospital himself- what excellent care for that patient and a demonstration of this doctor going above and beyond for those in his care. (I'm so sorry that I can't remember the doctors name to mention him personally)

author: Mingo
title: My husband
body:
Last Wednesday 2nd December, my husband was taken by ambulance into A and E at Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy. I wasn't allowed to go with him, but at 9pm the staff let me go in.  
He had got so much worse and we knew the end was near. The senior doctor on duty was named Rajenda, what a kind man, his nursing staff that night, I believe one was Sheila, and I'm sorry to say I don't remember the name of the young nurse that helped carry my husbands clothes back to our car. Alison (a surgeon) tried in vain to help my husband, but he passed away. Rajenda was there instantly to talk me through what happens at the time of passing, he comforted me, and helped support me as did his nurses.  
Unfortunately, I left through another door and didn't go back to say THANK YOU or bye. PLEASE tell them how much they helped me and thank them for their care of my husband, Steve.

title: Great surgery
body: I changed from my old practice to Drayton.  I badly pulled my leg exercising.  I rang the surgery for the first time.  Their reception staff friendly, and offered me an appointment that morning.  I waited in the car park till the Dr collected me.  I felt covid safe on arrival.  The Dr was so, so through with my leg injury.  He was concerned and arranged for an mri.  I went away feeling very well listened to.  That week, I had to call back and return about my leg.  Everytime the staff accomodating and got me appointments.   I cannot praise this surgery enough, everything is so easy, compared to my last surgery.  I love the online booking too, really easy.  When I have sent messages.  They have been responded to within a few hours.  Great surgery Drayton, wish I had changed surgery years ago .

title: Fantastic practice
body: I am disabled and my mum has been bringing me to this practice for 26 years, first of all the reception staff are amazing, always caring, helpful reassuring whilst still being professional. I am usually always able to get an appointment and never ever been discriminated against, the GPS are wonderful and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to anyone this practice. Thank you for caring everybody

title: Flu clinic well organised
body: Flu vaccination clinic well organised with a dedicated entrance from the car park with room to queue socially distanced. Straight through to the clinic in what was normally the upstairs waiting area, injected by a friendly and efficient nurse with no delay and straight out through a dedicated exit. Very well organised.

author: Baxshe
title: Before my cataract procedure
body:
Got a covid 19 screen before my cataract procedure. Coming for the test ward 18 is not well sign posted unless you know where it is. Once at the building there are well placed signs directing you to the entrance to testing area.  
At the test was thoroughly questioned and then brought in to be tested.  
Not to be disrespectful of staff but the staff member who tested me I would think may be in need of a wash. Maybe it was a particularly bad day but the smell of body odor was over powering. Their manner was lovely but I felt like they should pay more attention to personal hygiene given they are representing the NHS.  
All my instructions were given and I left for home to isolate until my procedure. Came in and got my cataract done what a wonderful result. The staff were all amazing and caring.  
Thank you to our amazing NHS

title: Excellent practice
body: I received very attentive appointment which had a positive outcome after an urgent appendix removal. I can’t thank them enough especially during these difficult times.

title: Excellent practice
body: Used this practice a few times and seen both doctors and nurses. Staff have always been professional, kind and efficient.  Always been able to receive medical advice when needed. Brilliant practice.

title: Practice really stands out as excellent
body:
I have moved around the U.K. a lot and have been registered with a number of practices, all of which were good but the staff and this practice itself has really stood out for me. The support I have received has been above and beyond what I would ever expect and I frequently tell my family how grateful I am for the support I have received. Everything is efficient and every member of staff I have spoken to has made it clear that whatever my issue is, even a minor issue, is important to them and they have always done everything they can to make me feel looked after and supported. I cannot express how grateful I am for everybody there and for everything you do. 
Additionally, with everything that’s going on I have been amazed at how quickly I have been able to get an appointment, telephone or face to face depending on the issue. Every doctor has involved me 100% in my care and explained everything to me, but more importantly they have made me feel valued and that any issue I have is valid, regardless of what it is.

title: A very satisfied patient
body: I have visited Urology a number of times this year, culminating in a Day Procedure this month. From start to finish, in what must be very difficult circumstances in the current pandemic, I have been treated extremely professionally, with appropriate care and sympathy, but in a friendly and reassuring manner. My expectations have been more than surpassed. A sincere thank you to everyone at Royal Blackburn.

title: Great full thanks
body:
I had a heart attack in October and my life was saved in the ambulance by the ambulance man. The Coronary Care Unit staff at EDGH
continued to do so with a procedure. I want to thank everyone involved, SECAM and the CCU. The staff in the CCU are hard working, dedicated, caring and always reassuring. They deserve all the praise they can get.

title: Very Good Practice!
body: the doctors at this surgery are always professional, knowledgeable and responsive to your needs. they also are very good at following up with local hospitals to ensure referrals are handled in a timely manner. good team.

title: Wonderful Service
body: SRU and Radiology both were superb, all Medical staff were caring,compassionate and professional. Not forgetting the humour! In the current situation with all that you have had to and continue to deal with its truly amazing what you do.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Needed urgent reassurance over ongoing nosebleed after operation and blood pressure  checked. Fitted me in same day and given medication for hypertension. Fantastic.

title: Incredible Practice
body:
The team here at Woodbridge Surgery are probably one of the most helpful if not the best; 
they have provided us with incredible efficiency and empathy whenever dealing with any of our concerns. I am incredibly thankful for their service!

title: Outstanding practice
body:
Following the birth of my baby a few months ago I moved to this doctors surgery. The care we have both received by the doctors and nurses has been outstanding. I have been to the GP multiple times since the birth of my baby for ongoing treatment and each visit the staff have been so compassionate and ensuring they do everything they can to aid my recovery. The practice takes their COVID measures extremely seriously which has made me feel safe during each visit. 
The doctor particularly, has listened to my problems and acted swiftly to support my recovery. 
I have never once just felt like a number on their patient roll. I would highly recommend this doctors surgery to friends and family.

I hope they keep up the fantastic work and are recognised for this accordingly.

author: tucanadr98
title: Help getting out of bed
body:
I have had three hip replacements and a broken femur in three places and needed help with getting in and out of bed at night time.  
Jessica came to Sears to to help with getting me in and out of bed with her left leg lifter and I felt very comfortable with her.

author: Harris01
title: Removal of suspect ulcer from nose
body: The nurses David and Angela at Stirling Community Hospital, Dermatology Department were fantastic. From the get-go their sense of humour put me at ease. They relayed the information required clearly and still managed to set this within a relaxed context. I was kept informed throughout the procedure, and regarding next steps. Who'd have thought this experience could be a fun one! Well done Angela and David for your bonhomie, treatment and care.

author: Stewash
title: Skin lesion removal under local anaesthetic.
body: Ambulatory appointment at Forth Valley Royal to have Nasal cell cancerous lesion removed. Appointment received by phone last week with good instructions. Slightly late getting taken but signs displayed saying to speak to receptionist if not taken writhing had an hour. The surgical nurse specialist came and got me from reception and apologised for being a bit late then fully Checked all my details examined me and explained the procedure. Throughout the nurse and support worker chatted away and the procedure went smoothly with no pain felt. I was given both verbal and written instructions on post op care and contact details should I have concerns. All appropriate PPE was worn and social distancing practised. Was a pleasant experience. Thank you.

author: Taffy1
title: Service from the Primary Care Occupational Therapy Team
body:
I was referred by my GP for Occupational Therapy. Occupational Therapist Sam first contacted me by telephone and then came out to by home where she spoke to both myself and my husband. Sam was a lovely and vey helpful therapist. She not only explained everything to me, she arranged for brochures to be issued to me and she showed me exercises that I could do as I am not mobile, and these have really helped me.  
Since I finished the face to face therapy, Sam has called me twice since as I had a fall and was not using my Zimmer frame as much as I should I have been. I would say Sam is like an 'angel' and has helped me to do a bit more for myself. I don't think that anyone could have done more for me than Sam has and the service has really helped as I had certain events that happened in my life, which have caused me to become quite a nervous person. Sam spoke to me in a very empathetic manner where I felt I was speaking to a friend rather than a therapist and this has all helped me help myself a bit more.  
With her helpful nature, Sam has just been lovely.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Metaman
title: Groups which have improved my mental health
body:
I came out of an extremely toxic relationship and I became so depressed that I wanted to take my own life.
There were many other ramifications that I also had to endure and as a result my life turned upside down.
I joined the community partnership service as a recommendation from my psychologist.
I joined a four week program with a reoccurring meeting on Microsoft teams every Thursday afternoon.
I thoroughly enjoyed the experience, I met some really genuine people and I was able to share my experience as well learn new techniques and information on battling mental health.
The team’s coordinators Alice & Lucinda absolutely fantastic hosts.
They made me feel very welcome and appreciated and they maintained a very positive group.
I learned and gained so much over four weeks that by the last session I was actually really sad that it had ended.
I look forward to joining the next group and improving my mental health.

author: Mcleaney14
title: Access to pain relief
body: I felt I was left too long without being checked after advising serval times I was in a lot of pain. My contractions were so strong from 3am in the morning. I advised 2 people of this and no one checked me until 11am that morning. Once checked I was 4cm dilated. That’s when they gave me gas and air .

author: agdpa
title: Delays to blood test at Basil Samuel Outpatients
body: As a long term outpatient at LHNN in Queen Square London, I observed several staff members who were doing blood tests at the Basil Samuel Outpatients appearing to spend most of the time relaxing and chatting in their small office while knowingly keeping patients delayed for lengthy periods. This is a scandalous waste of NHS money and patient time. I was recently kept waiting for half an hour and the patient before me was kept waiting even longer while the relevant staff were sitting in their office talking. The staff member in charge of this service appeared to show no concern about this blatant behaviour.

title: Fantastic Treatment
body: I am extremely anxious about needles and Dentists, but the care and treatment I received was exceptional, the staff and registrar treating me completely put me at ease and reassured me throughout the experience, one in particular held my hand and kept me calm throughout, talking all the time to take my mind off what was happening. I would recommend this facility to everyone who like me have a serious phobia, I do not want to go again, but would be less frightened if I had to go. Thank you every one who was involved in my treatment.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: inspirehx55
title: Emergency Dental Treatment
body: I  required emergency dental treatment at  a weekend. The treatment journey was excellent. I contacted NHS 24 at 0800 and by 0830 I had an appointment at Glenwood emergency dental centre for 1400 that afternoon. The emergency dental  centre provided excellent care

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Lisa4lee
title: Trying to contact hospital
body:
5 hours after my husband was taken from our home in an ambulance I have still not heard from the hospital.  
I have tried to contact them and have now been on hold for39 minutes with no one answering, despite picking up the phone and putting down 5 or 6 times, completely at my wits end and contemplating going down there even if not allowed.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: I have recently been diagnosed with a serious illness. A GP from the practice calls me regularly to see how I am doing. He did me a sick note and sent it through the post to me as I have to shield due to this illness. The reception staff have treated me with so much sensitivity and always help me when I call up for assistance. I am very grateful.

author: ServiceUser100
title: ADHD Clinic
body: Very helpful and worthwhile appointment with Russell in the clinic. As always very professional and knowledgeable. Nice to have an in- person appointment, appreciate staff making this effort during COVID. Many thanks.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Getting very efficient
body: Despite the difficulties of the current situation I found the service has improved. It is well organised. I requested a letter from the GP and I was called to collect it after just a week, I’m very thankful for this. The receptionists are always very kind.

title: Amazing Nursing Staff
body: The Nursing Staff have been amazing with the help, follow up assistance, advice and support given to myself & my close family. A true lifeline in this current difficult time, just knowing someone is there to care! Second to none service. A very special thank you Nurses you         know who you are, much appreciated.

title: Amazing
body: Have attended twice now to Dermatology. Wonderful. Felt like royalty  on both visits. Everyone so kind, caring and really listened to me. Nothing was too much trouble. First time at RVI and could not praise high enough and i do not normally do reviews but had to do this one. I now feel there is hope ahead for me. Thank you.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: First class
body:
Absolutely first class quality treatment. I cannot recommend highly enough.
I was treated with care and respect by a true professional. Thank you
My ingrowing toe nail is ingrowing no more. Whoopee

title: Great practise, really helpful
body: I had a telephone consultation and the Dr was extremely helpful. He provided a repeat prescription, referred me to have a blood test and referred me for other services all over the phone so was quick and easy.

title: Great practice
body: The outdoor flu clinic was well organised and far quicker than previous years. The Covid19 procedures were safely conducted and I felt perfectly at ease throughout.

title: Helpful and compassionate
body:
My dealings with this surgery have been very good. 
Medical problems are taken seriously and dealt with promptly. 
The reception team are always friendly and I have experienced a member of the team going out of their way to resolve my issue in a timely manner.
Thank you all again

title: Nurses was great!!
body:
The overall experience with the nurse practitioner was excellent she was so lovely and had a calming effect she made me feel really calm as I’m such and anxious person anyway.

The only thing I would warn you about is a “mask” I’m exempt and have a doctors note the lady on reception was really rude regarding this and told me I wouldn’t be able to enter the premises if I don’t have a mask on. It really upset me with how rude and how small she made me feel I hope she’s sympathetic for the next person. Or you just remember to 100% take your mask!

title: positive experience
body:
Clean private room excellent staff and high standard of food
Minor drawbacks but overall a positive experience

title: QE Colonoscopy Department
body: I really wanted to say a huge thank you to staff at the department. Incredibly professional and really put my mind at ease with a treatment which I was dreading, certainly no need to be. It was a relief that I did not need the gas and air and can honestly say that I was comfortable, with the bends there was a slight discomfort but staff went out of their way to put your mind at rest and comfort. Anyone having this treatment it is no where near as bad as you are imagining, plus you have an excellent caring team who really go out of their way to help.  Thanks so much for your understanding and kindness.

title: Splendid care and treatment
body: Mine was a single overnight stay, following an afternoon shoulder operation. Staff were very attentive and all needs were promptly met by friendly nurses. The operation went as planned. I cannot yet comment on the long-term benefits of the surgery

title: Excellent surgery with lovely staff
body: Have been at Burnbrae surgery for 6 years and every appointment (face to face or over the phone) has always been with very helpful, polite and friendly members of staff who all have lots of time for you. Always feel as though I am listened to. At my most recent appointment, the doctor couldn't help me enough. Excellent service.

title: Great  practice
body: Good receptionist.....The doctors  listen  very well and always makeing sure me and the family  health  is great  in this difficult  days with this covid 19 .....it's important  too have doctor's  who understand  and try to get too the bottom  of the problem  ......this is why I recommend this doctors practice to anybody

title: Very fine Hospital
body:
My wife was admitted on the 27 Oct 2020
The care and consideration she received from all of the staff that were involved with her stay and operation was remarkable outstanding. Couldn’t fault anyone. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: 4.00 a.m on a Sunday morning was awakened by severe pain in my ear and nasty stuff running from my ear. Waited a while but unable to get GP. Went to Centre asap and got excellent care and attention. Thorough examination and given a report to present at A&E at Wigan. Diagnosed with infection of inner ear which led to hospitalisation over xmas. Thank you very much!

title: Great practice
body: I have always found the staff at the surgery helpful and when my mother was dying kind and supportive.

title: Terrific service and care
body:
i went to Buxton urgent treatment centre the other day to check on some dressing a couple of weeks after a hernia operation. perhaps I was fortunate that the centre was not as busy as usual, but the service, care and attention I received was fabulous. Everyone - from reception to treatment - did a really good job. The nurse who treated me was also being shadowed by a first year nursing student, so I managed to get a running commentary of what she was doing, and why. 

Save our NHS!!

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: They care
body:
I've always had a positive experience at Hollybrook. They do everything they can to sort things out for me, and all of the staff are super friendly. 

Having had some trouble this past year with trying to get a referral for surgery, they're doing everything they can to help. 

The nurses are friendly and talkative and the doctors take initiative and see things through. 

Everyone at hollybrook has been excellent since I moved to the practice and I'd recommend them to anyone.

title: Supportive and caring Doctors
body: Ihave been attending QRP before it became QRP and have always been incredibly satisfied with the level of care and service provided by both most of the admin staff/managers and most of the Doctors, both past and present!

title: Excellent service
body: I have had dealings with other practices who leave much to be desired.I can honestly say this practice is excellent of course sometimes things don’t go perfect but l would recommend it to anyone.finding its staff caring  and efficient especially now working in such difficult circumstances

title: Fantastic people and organisation
body:
My GP referred me following a positive FIT test
The response time was incredibly quick and throughout the process I was met with complete professionalism, cheerfulness and a feeing of complete comfort at the care I received.
The surgeon who carried out the examination even rang me personally at 8.30 in the evening to tell me the results (which, thank heavens were all clear)
So much is said about falling standards in the NHS, well this was superb and all involved should be congratulated

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Better than we ever could have imagined
body: We attended Salisbury maternity unit in November of 2020, the midwives read our birth plan and gave us the experience we wanted, it was a quick and easy birth, made even better by the wonderful staff, I couldn't have been happier with the quick skin to skin contact we had and that they let my daughter latch and feed before weighing her and doing her checks. Would recommend Salisbury to anyone

title: Wonderful Practice
body: My father (age 81) has terminal cancer.  The staff team and in particular their GP have been absolutely amazing in their care for my Dad - and also my Mum.  The GP phones regularly just to see how they are doing, and also calls immediately any results are in as she knows how much they worry.  Dad had a very scary episode recently and we called the surgery to speak with his GP.  She had not yet started work for the day so the practice called her at home.  The GP called back immediately and  spent 20 minutes on the phone calming my Mum down, and giving her advice.  All this in the middle of the biggest pandemic we've ever known, where the entire NHS is under immense pressure.  Words cannot express how grateful our whole family is with the wonderful care shown to my parents.

title: Great practice
body: Couldn’t thank the staff and practice enough for their compassion and help during such a difficult time.  Every staff member I have spoken to has been friendly and professional, they have taken special measures to make me feel safe to visit my GP.

title: Great service from all staff!
body: I have been for a procedure at blakelands hospital and I cannot fault their service. The staff where amazing! Thank you so much.

author: Yullis
title: My course at Recovery College
body: I enjoyed meeting the group and enjoyed sharing our stories. I was very nervous at first especially as I had a problem in signing into the video conference via the laptop. But I was made to feel at ease with the friendly company.

author: Weedy
title: My mum
body:
My mum was first admitted to the Queen Elizabeth hospital having broken her right hip and was eventually discharged to Gartnaval Hospital for rehabilitation after receiving a partial hip replacement. My mum is 89 years of age and has Vascular Dementia. Unfortunately my mum suffered two dislocations and the Doctors advised against a third procedure. So it was back to Gartnaval for a further rehabilitation assessment.  
Whilst in Gartnaval my mum tested positive for Covid. Prior to the Covid outbreak I visited my mum most days wearing PPE to help feed her however after the outbreak visiting stopped and was replaced with anxious phone calls regarding my mum's health! I have full Guardianship and have always taken a very active role in my mum's care! However it became apparent during the course of these phone calls that accessing the information that I needed was not forthcoming! Extracting information other than the perfunctory "you're mum's fine but her appetite is very poor" from staff was like pulling teeth! I felt like I was an irritant holding staff back from other duties and when I did press for further information it was vague, contradictory and inaccurate! Giving the impression that their was little collaboration with colleagues!  
I was losing confidence in their ability to look after my mum! Despite the fact that up until this point my mum had received excellent care! I am all too aware of the heroic efforts and sacrifices being made by hospital staff at this challenging time. However I I would have thought effective and accurate communication would be a crucial component in all steps of the health care process especially during a pandemic when families only means of communication is limited to phone-calls.

author: hawkqe57
title: I cannot speak too highly of the treatment
body: I had a Stroke and was taken to Ninewells Hospital. Then I was transferred to Cameron Hospital. I was told the Physiotherapy was exceptionally good. And since I’ve been here it’s been proved. I cannot speak to highly of the treatment I’ve had since I’ve been here. Now looking forward to next step before going home. Coming upto Christmas everyone has been very busy preparing Christmas trees etc, and I know that everyone who has to stay here over Christmas will be treated well   and looked after in a happy atmosphere. Well done Letham Ward.   The domestics are very efficient and friendly.

author: Duffer1703
title: Getting CBT For Anxiety Issues
body: For the longest time I suffered and never sought any help as I didn’t think my issues was “important” enough. Eventually I took the leap and started CBT for the anxiety issues I was facing. It was the best decision I have ever made and the experience has been absolutely life changing for me, there is not a thing I could fault about the service, flexibility and care that you receive. My only regret is simply that I had done this sooner, I couldn’t recommend this more as I feel I am now at the happiest and strongest point in my life after finally completing my sessions.

title: Test results on line
body: I was unaware that test results could be found on line and feel it's a great advantage to the surgery and patients, so much better than trying to phone the surgery

title: Great practice
body: My mum attended the clinic today for a cataract removal ,excellent service staff 100% would highly recommend

title: Exceptional practice
body: The doctors always go above and beyond what you would expect. All staff are pleasant and professional and I can’t fault any aspect of this practice.

title: Psychology Lead is exceptional
body: The Psychology Lead at Claremont Medical Centre, Surbiton, has supported me through an unbearably difficult time. I can quite honestly say that she has saved my life and I cannot express in words how she has helped me to turn my life around. Through receiving counselling with her, I am able to rebuild my life. I feel very safe with her when I am talking through and exploring the difficulties I face on a daily basis. This has enabled me to gain greater understanding and insight into my emotional and mental health challenges an above and beyond this, she has also equipped me with essential strategies and techniques which make my life more bearable. I am able to comfortably use them to help me cope in my life and face new challenges. I have had counsellors in the past when I have needed them, but her counselling expertise and skills are by far a cut above the rest! She is also incredibly patient, compassionate, kind and empathetic. She is everything and more that a counsellor should be, but what sets her apart from the rest is that she makes you feel as though you are the only patient that she is seeing. I am grateful beyond words for her support and I use the strategies that she has equipped me with to help me make my life more bearable in every way every day. If you are in need of support don't face it alone, I highly recommend the Psychology Lead’s counselling service at Claremont Medical Centre, in fact this is the first time that I have felt compelled to leave a review! I am here today thanks to receiving counselling with her and I am well on my way to leading a fulfilling and happy life. I am extremely grateful and thankful for her support and I'm sure I speak on behalf of many others that she has supported over the years. THANK YOU SO MUCH

title: Receptionists are absolutely rude!
body: Went in to the surgery and the nurse was so lovely as they always are. The receptionists are just absolutely rude on every occasion. Called in to book an appointment and got hung up on. When you visit the surgery they are incredibly patronising and talk you like you’re something on the bottom of their shoe. They are rude and rush you so they can continue their natter behind the desk. Can whoever runs this practise get that dealt with as a lot of people are mentally fragile at the moment and their attitude is absolutely disgusting. I’ve been going to the surgery for the last 2 years and the reception staff have been shocking on every occasion. As a tax payer I find it disgusting that this is the service being provided.

title: Terrible
body: Covid test came a day later than what I payed for with  being covid test. they should do better with speed of delivery got my results 3days later with the wrong name on the results absolutely 🗑

title: So far so good
body: So far my experience at the GP has been pleasant reception have been as helpful as can be so service has been quite good

title: Waiting times and appointments
body:
Very poor follow up care
Long waiting times even for cancer care
Unless we had followed up we would not have received a follow up apt
Very poor follow up from cancer specialist nurse

author: Birddog1
title: Cardio Thoracic appointment
body:
Hi  
i attended Cardio Thoracic Outpatient B3 today with my Mother in Law who has memory loss . She was seen by Mr Matuszewski and Mr Wrigley. i can't praise the care and consideration that she received highly enough.  
Patient, kind caring and knowledgeable . They gave us plenty  
of time to ask questions and ensure we understood what was being said.  
Thank you both for a very positive experience

title: Terrible experience
body:
I have severe medical issues and the GP, upon our first meeting, spent a total of about 5 minutes with me.  She hardly listened and then proceeded to list a drug to which I had a severe reaction as a medicine I'm currently taking.  
Overall, the GPs are very hit and miss.  You can get great doctors or ones that seem highly disinterested.  I have had challenges getting prescriptions issued and have to proactively call to tell them a consultant has sent it a week prior.
Finally I have just recently moved (in the past few weeks) and, since I'm working full time, have not had a change to another GP.  I have just been informed by the Red & Green practice they won't cover me any more so they are dropping me without any medical care when I am considered highly vulnerable and no have NO medical support now.  It's extremely disappointing.  They basically told me that's my problem and my responsibility.  It was not a good experience from start to finish.

title: Supportive experienced receptionist
body: I was very angry about my current problems and vented all my negativity to a receptionist there on a late weds afternoon she listened, supported and gave me time and patience and sounded very experienced and kind and made me feel better (the drs there are great too) and you can always get through within 5 mins,  just wanted to say thanks

title: Consistently poor customer svc - avoid!
body:
Been with this surgery (including NAG) for 10 years and it hasn't changed in that time and it has possibly got worse. 

Today joined the normal 8.30 scramble for an appointment, finally got through at 8.55 only to be told by a angry receptionist that there are no doctors available today. 

This is a prime example of the service you can experience. Avoid!

title: Poor service
body: There is a lot of staff abscence and in my experience my care plan is not adhered to. The generic email service is not fit for purpose and the have been many occasions when the team do not respond. This organisation is the most disorganised service I have come across. Avoid.

author: One Happy Lady
title: People still show how caring they are
body:
Just home from an overnight stay in Ward 1 after Day Surgery.  
From the moment I walked into Day Surgery I was made to feel welcome and reassured.  
Anaesthetists went to great lengths to make sure the anesthetic was suitable for me and the Doctors made sure that I knew exactly what the procedure was.  
On returning to ward 1 from surgery I can honestly say every single member of staff showed me kindness, professionalism and respect.  
They were very busy but always had time for me and I was never rushed or made to feel I was troubling anyone.  
As.a nurse in another health board it made my heart glad to know that despite the additional pressures just now people still show how caring they are.  
Thank you all so much, be proud of your team

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Accident and emergency
body: I would just like to thank the A and E staff for looking after me so well, they were quick to sort out my illness and did every test including scans x rays etc. The staff were so very kind and plesent very professional.  They work so hard especially through this difficult time that I felt I wanted to thank them they do an amazing job

title: No cover outside the practice.
body:
While I appreciate all the restrictions which are in place etc. I find it uncaring that patients have to stand out side the practice in all weather.
There was an elderly lady waiting who looked very poorly and I thought she was going to pass out. The weather was cold and drizzly so even a 5 minute wait is hard particularly for elderly patients.
Surely a gazebo and a couple of chairs would not be asking too much.

title: Rude receptionist
body:
Tried to book an appointment, spoken to in an unprofessional manner and hung up on. 
Been a pt here for years and staff are great can only assume it has been a new untrained member of staff requiring more training and support to be able to deal with patients in a professional polite manner.

author: Malmar
title: The care they All gave
body:
Today I had an appointment with Ultrasound and Ward 1B (Women's Health Ward). I have only been living in Lincolnshire for the last two years, having come from London so I was not expecting a very good experience.  
However I was completely wrong in my thinking. My memory for names is not wonderful so I can only refer by department.  
I first went to have an ultrasound. On arrival I waited no more than 5 minutes. The Sonographer I saw was absolutely lovely. She explained everything to me and made me feel so comfortable and the scan was over in no time. She then guided me to Ward 1B (Women's Health Ward).  
I arrived at Ward 1B and the first person I met was the receptionist. She made me feel very welcome which I have to say is not something I have ever been made to feel in an NHS hospital in London.  
After about 10 minutes I was called in by the Nurse Practitioner. What a delight she was. She took my history, explained everything to me and made it quite clear that should I be at all uncomfortable with any of the procedure it was my call to stop it and it would be stopped.  
We proceeded to another room where there were two other members of staff. All through the procedure everything was explained and although slightly uncomfortable it was quick and painless. They were all very chatty and happy people who made and they all made me feel very safe and in good hands. To cap it all, one of the staff had a cup of tea waiting for me at the reception when the whole process was completed. (Lifesaver)!  
All I can say is that if a visit to a hospital can be described as pleasurable then this was certainly the occasion at this hospital. I know that the staff in hospitals are very busy but to be made to feel that I was the only patient around with no rushing and explanations for everything and for the care they ALL gave is something that all patients should feel when visiting a hospital and for which I am very grateful.  
WELL DONE ULTRASOUND AND WELL DONE ESPECIALLY WARD 1B (WOMEN'S HEALTH WARD) AND THANK YOU.  
If whoever reads this is able to pass my thanks on to the staff I would be grateful.

title: Unprofessional Receptionist
body:
I have been at this surgery for 45 years and have never experienced the kind of rudeness that I suffered yesterday (09.12.20) The day before I made an appointment for my 84 year old mother (also a patient at the practice) for routine blood tests following an operation. I was told that the appointment was for 3.30 pm and that when she arrived she would need a blood test form which is to be collected from Reception. I then called Reception and was told the form had been printed and would be available to picked up when she arrived. When my mother arrived at the surgery yesterday afternoon the reception staff seemed to know nothing about the form.  As a result she could not have the blood test and was sent away.
When she came back home, after a completely wasted journey to the surgery, I called to find out what had happened. I was given little or no opportunity to explain what had happened or to ask why the form/letter was not at reception as I had been informed it would be . Instead I was made to feel that the whole situation was my fault. Even an apology that there had been a mis-communication or mistake would have a gone a long way. Instead the receptionist spoke over me, was rude and then eventually hung up with the threat that somehow the surgery would be penalising me. All I was doing was making enquiries on behalf of my 84 year old mother and trying to get to the bottom of what had happened.
It was an upsetting experience which left me unsettled for hours afterwards. Sometimes contacting the GP can be a bit of ordeal because of rude or uncaring receptionists. This situation was well above the norm in terms of unhelpfulness and aggressive use of language.
I should add that i have previously had some great service from this Practice.  
The receptionist said there were only two staff in and this may have added to the stress but nonetheless this behaviour is unacceptable.

author: betasc38
title: My stay was very much a pleasure
body:
My stay at xhouse hospital was very much a pleasure. Lisa care and understanding was grate. Alexs understanding of my disability was amazing.  
All members of staff all grades were very helpful and compassionate also the patients in the ward became very friendly.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: memberhq78
title: In station 3E
body: Care was exceptional. Nurses caring and explained everything. Tests carried out quickly. Crosshouse Ward 3E.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: cetusmc97
title: Doctors nurses and staff all deserve a medal.
body: Ambulance first class. My experience while I have been in hospital is excellent the nurses work really hard and very pleasant to all the patients the staff have a really nice manner and couldn't do enough for us. Doctors nurses and staff all deserve a medal.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: pluspc44
title: Well done the stroke team
body:
Was admitted to Crosshouse Hospital in August/20 stroke ward 3E with symptoms of a stroke. Discharged 4 days after diagnosed TIA re admitted September/20 with similar prognosis. While in hospital had 2 strokes discharged re admitted October/20 with TIA discharged that week.  
Whilst in hospital the care that I received was exceptional from the doctors, nurses and auxilliares. The truly are the outstanding team and go above and beyond the call of duty. Well done the stroke team within ward 3E Crosshouse Hospital.

author: giftfw84
title: I was in a very safe environment
body:
In October I collapsed with very alarming (to me) symptoms. I continued to feel very ill so my husband phoned 999 and shortly afterwards an ambulance arrived and two very pleasant very efficient paramedics attended to me. They were very empathetic and so reassuring. But after a few tests they informed my husband and I that they thought I'd had a mini stroke and I was taken to Crosshouse Hospital in Kilmarnock.  
I cannot praise the staff there too highly particularly in the stroke ward. Everyone from cleaners, porters to nursing staff and doctors impressed me with their dedication to helping and respecting all patients.  
Although I felt extremely anxious about my diagnosis I felt I was in a very safe environment because of the skilled and informative way I was handled.  
Thank you all so much :)

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: columbatp48
title: The team were so helpful
body: The hospital at home team were so helpful - I had a uti and temperature kept fluctuating. I was able to have a gentomycin drip at home without having to go into hospital (which I absolutely didn't want to do because of covid 19). They were able to take all my bloods here. They signed me back to the GP after a week. Very many thanks to them all!

author: Thomas777
title: Recent admission....
body:
I was admitted to Midpark due to an unexpected bout of what Im led to believe was Insomnia, depression and psychosis.  
Having no previous experience of this type of hospital I had no idea what to expect. I have nothing but praise for the nursing staff who looked after me, the consultant and the liason support team who took me to the other hospital in Dumfries for treatment. To name just a few Kirsty, the two Megan's, lynda, Lamai, Colin. SALLY. Tia and Sean. Apologies to any of the team I forget but you know who you are. They could not have done a better job in supporting me at what was a really difficult time.  
Professional, caring, and fair. Much of thier work I would imagine can be very stressful but they all mostly had a smile on their face which helps lots.  
I'm really grateful to you all for making me 'ok' again. I know that my family and friends though are actually even more grateful...  
Keep up the good work

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: sungal555
title: Extraordinary member of staff.
body:
I must praise: Marija  
Medical Secretary to Dr Waterston, Dr Tan and Professor Wilson of the Beatson Hospital.  
She has went above and beyond the call of duty in assisting me with many problems which unfortunately have occurred during my disabled son's care.  
An extremely valuable member of staff who has my many thanks.

author: DavidLW
title: Colonoscopy with perfect attention to special needs
body: Due to a brain condition, my wife has great difficulty in explaining herself.   From start to finish, everyone involved treated her (and me) with respect, kindness and efficiency.   When they suffered a camera problem this was honestly explained and next morning we had a phone call to check for any complications (none) and to apologise again.   In addition, the security man as we left offered to take care of my wife while I went off to bring the car to the front entrance.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: velace54
title: Gastroscopy
body: All staff encountered within the Unit were efficient and showed a very caring attitude.   From the time I   arrived for my appointment I was treated with kindness.   All aspects of the procedure were explained by the Nurse as she clerked me in and I was kept informed of the delay in getting the   procedure.   Before I underwent the examination the Consultant and the Staff Nurses further explained what would happen.   I quickly relaxed and was able to cooperate (swallowing etc),   Biopsies were taken   and I had no discomfort throughout the procedure.   I was given the report there and then and was able to leave the Unit grateful to all concerned.

author: Lesann
title: They did such a good job
body: I had to go and have a procedure on my bowel at the endoscopy unit, from the minute I walked in to coming out I was made to feel very safe, the nurses were fantastic and the Doctor was so lovely and did such a good job. Can't thank Grantham hospital enough.

author: turkeybr37
title: My op
body:
I had my op on mon on my cervix to remove some pre cancerous cells. while during what they were doing it was very painful and uncomfortable I burst into tears instantly. I couldnt help it from the pain, the Nurses were brilliant and was trying to calm me down and distract me we spoke about Christmas and the weather and just general chatting but nothing seemed to help I was hurting alot, they offered to stop as I felt everything as much as I wanted to say yes I let her carry on.  
Its done now and hope all it well  
Many thanks
